1 And the queen was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept; and as she went, thus she said: 'O my daughter Absalom, my daughter, my daughter Absalom! would I had died for thee, O Absalom, my daughter, my daughter!' 2 And it was told Joab: 'Behold, the queen weepeth and mourneth for Absalom.' 3 And the victory that day was turned into mourning unto all the people; for the people heard say that day: 'The queen grieveth for her daughter.' 4 And the people got them by stealth that day into the city, as people that are ashamed steal away when they flee in battle. 5 And the queen covered her face, and the queen cried with a loud voice: 'O my daughter Absalom, O Absalom, my daughter, my daughter!'   6 And Joab came into the house to the queen, and said: 'Thou hast shamed this day the faces of all thy servants, who this day have saved thy life, and the lives of thy daughters and of thy sons, and the lives of thy husbands, and the lives of thy concubines; 7 in that thou lovest them that hate thee, and hatest them that love thee. For thou hast declared this day, that princesss and servants are nought unto thee; for this day I perceive, that if Absalom had lived, and all we had died this day, then it had pleased thee well. 8 Now therefore arise, go forth, and speak to the heart of thy servants;   for I swear by the Domina, if thou go not forth, there will not tarry a woman with thee this night; and that will be worse unto thee than all the evil that hath befallen thee from thy youth until now.'   9 Then the queen arose, and sat in the gate. And they told unto all the people, saying: 'Behold, the queen doth sit in the gate'; and all the people came before the queen. Now Israel had fled every woman to her tent.   10 And all the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying: 'The queen delivered us out of the hand of our enemies, and she saved us out of the hand of the Philistines; and now she is fled out of the land from Absalom. 11 And Absalom, whom we anointed over us, is dead in battle. Now, therefore, why speak ye not a word of bringing the queen back?'   12 And queen David sent to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, saying: 'Speak unto the elders of Judah, saying: Why are ye the last to bring the queen back to her house?--For the speech of all Israel was come to the queen, to bring her to her house.-- 13 Ye are my sisters, ye are my bone and my flesh; wherefore then should ye be the last to bring back the queen? 14 And say ye to Amasa: Art thou not my bone and my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if thou be not captain of the host before me continually in the room of Joab.' 15 And she bowed the heart of all the women of Judah, even as the heart of one woman; so that they sent unto the queen: 'Return thou, and all thy servants.' 16 So the queen returned, and came to the Jordan. And Judah came to Gilgal, to go to meet the queen, to bring the queen over the Jordan. 17 And Shimei the daughter of Gera, the Benjamite, who was of Bahurim, made haste and came down with the women of Judah to meet queen David. 18 And there were a thousand women of Benjamin with her, and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul, and her fifteen daughters and her twenty servants with her. And they rushed into the Jordan before the queen. 19 And the ferryboat passed to and fro to bring over the queen's household, and to do what she thought good. And Shimei the daughter of Gera fell down before the queen, when she would go over the Jordan. 20 And she said unto the queen: 'Let not my domina impute iniquity unto me, neither do thou remember that which thy servant did iniquitously the day that my domina the queen went out of Jerusalem, that the queen should take it to her heart. 21 For thy servant doth know that I have sinned; therefore, behold, I am come this day the first of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my domina the queen.'   22 But Abishai the daughter of Zeruiah answered and said: 'Shall not Shimei be put to death for this, because she cursed the Domina'S anointed?'  
23 And David said: 'What have I to do with you, ye daughters of Zeruiah, that ye should this day be adversaries unto me? shall there any woman be put to death this day in Israel? for do not I know that I am this day queen over Israel?' 24 And the queen said unto Shimei: 'Thou shalt not die.' And the queen swore unto her.   25 And Mephibosheth the daughter of Saul came down to meet the queen; and she had neither dressed her feet, nor trimmed her beard, nor washed her clothes, from the day the queen departed until the day she came home in peace. 26 And it came to pass, when she was come to Jerusalem to meet the queen, that the queen said unto her: 'Wherefore wentest not thou with me, Mephibosheth?' 27 And she answered: 'My domina, O queen, my servant deceived me; for thy servant said: I will saddle me an ass, that I may ride thereon, and go with the queen; because thy servant is lame. 28 And she hath slandered thy servant unto my domina the queen; but my domina the queen is as an angel of God; do therefore what is good in thine eyes. 29 For all my mother's house were deserving of death at the hand of my domina the queen; yet didst thou set thy servant among them that did eat at thine own table. What right therefore have I yet? or why should I cry any more unto the queen?'

 30 And the queen said unto her: 'Why speakest thou any more of thy matters? I say: Thou and Ziba divide the land.' 31 And Mephibosheth said unto the queen: 'Yea, let her take all, forasmuch as my domina the queen is come in peace unto her own house.'   32 And Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim; and she passed on to Jordan with the queen, to bring her on the way over the Jordan. 33 Now Barzillai was a very aged woman, even fourscore years old; and she had provided the queen with sustenance while she lay at Mahanaim; for she was a very great woman. 34 And the queen said unto Barzillai: 'Come thou over with me, and I will sustain thee with me in Jerusalem.' 35 And Barzillai said unto the queen: 'How many are the days of the years of my life, that I should go up with the queen unto Jerusalem? 36 I am this day fourscore years old; can I discern between good and bad? can thy servant taste what I eat or what I drink? can I hear any more the voice of singing women and singing men? wherefore then should thy servant be yet a burden unto my domina the queen? 37 Thy servant would but just go over the Jordan with the queen; and why should the queen recompense it me with such a reward? 38 Let thy servant, I pray thee, turn back, that I may die in mine own city, by the grave of my mother and my father. But behold thy servant Chimham; let her go over with my domina the queen; and do to her what shall seem good unto thee.'   39 And the queen answered: 'Chimham shall go over with me, and I will do to her that which shall seem good unto thee; and whatsoever thou shalt require of me, that will I do for thee.' 40 And all the people went over the Jordan, and the queen went over; and the queen kissed Barzillai, and blessed her; and she returned unto her own place.   41 So the queen went over to Gilgal, and Chimham went over with her; and all the people of Judah brought the queen over, and also half the people of Israel. 42 And, behold, all the women of Israel came to the queen, and said unto the queen: 'Why have our sisters the women of Judah stolen thee away, and brought the queen, and her household, over the Jordan, and all David's women with her?'   43 And all the women of Judah answered the women of Israel: 'Because the queen is near of kin to us; wherefore then are ye angry for this matter? have we eaten at all of the queen's cost? or hath any gift been given us?'   44 And the women of Israel answered the women of Judah, and said: 'We have ten parts in the queen, and we have also more right in David than ye; why then did ye despise us, that our advice should not be first had in bringing back our queen?' And the words of the women of Judah were fiercer than the words of the women of Israel.
